intro: Tristegis, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or subshrubs native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Europe. The plants are characterized by their simple, often hairy leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring. Tristegis species are typically found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are often used in garden landscapes.
